column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced    Hydrogeologist    to join our team, who will be playing a key role in implementing hydrogeological projects and solutions, contributing to water resource management, environmental assessments, and sustainable development initiatives.         At WOTR your Key Resource Areas will be:             Project Planning   : Collaboratively design and plan hydrogeological projects with multidisciplinary teams to meet project goals and client needs.           Field Investigations   : Perform comprehensive field investigations, encompassing site assessments, groundwater sampling, well monitoring, and aquifer delineation, while upholding best practices and safety standards.           Data Collection and Analysis   : Collect diverse hydrogeological data, apply analysis to define aquifer traits, groundwater flow, and contaminant migration.           Report Writing   : Produce succinct technical reports elucidating findings, methods, and recommendations for clients, regulators, and stakeholders.           Regulatory Compliance   : Maintain project compliance with evolving regulatory standards.           Project Management   : Efficiently oversee project timelines, budgets, resources, and team coordination for successful delivery.           Capacity Building   : Empower communities and professionals through training in sustainable water management for active conservation involvement.           Quality Assurance   : Maintain high-quality standards for project deliverables through accurate data and rigorous analysis.           Research and Innovation   : Apply innovative solutions to address complex water challenges effectively.           Environmental Protection   : Assess potential environmental impacts of water resource activities and propose mitigation strategies to safeguard ecosystems and biodiversity.           Infrastructure Development   : Plan and design water infrastructure projects, such as wells, recharge facilities, and water treatment systems, considering ecological impact and resilience against climate change.           Sustainable Planning   : Develop and implement sustainable water management plans that balance water demand with available resources           Aquifer Management   : Monitor and manage aquifers to ensure their sustainable use through proper extraction and recharge strategies.           Water Conservation   : Design and promote water conservation measures and practices to reduce wastage and ensure efficient water use.           Apply if you have:           A Master s degree in Hydrogeology/ Geology/ Water Resource Development/ Environmental Science or a related field         Minimum 3 years proven hydrogeological project implementation experience, preferably across diverse geological contexts         Familiarity with climate change and its impacts on water resources         Fluency in English and basic communication in Hindi         Strong data analysis skills, understanding of environmental regulations and permissions. Project management experience would be a plus.         Proven collaborative skills in multidisciplinary teams with strong problem-solving acumen and keen attention to detail
column11: Water treatment, Data analysis, Environmental science, Project implementation, Manager Quality Assurance, Project management, Data collection, Project planning, Resource management, Monitoring

column2: Urgent : DGM / Sr. Manager ( Wind EPC ) @ Mumbai  Our client is an industry leader in clean energy solutions & has over a decade of experience in executing large-scale and complex renewable energy projects.  Solutions cover the gamut of renewable power from solar, wind &  hybrid power , Floating solar power , Battery storage solutions & also Futuristic technologies. Input Matrix :  Work From Office Industry :  Renewable Power industry Department:  Engineering/Project Management Who is an ideal candidate ? Mandatory Educational Requirements :  B.E./B.Tech (Electrical)  Preferred Qualification  : MTech., MBA 15-22 years of experience in  Wind EPC. Excel in Project Planning, Design, Procurement  & Construction, ensuring successful project execution while meeting quality, safety, cost, & timeline objectives in India's renewable energy sector. Mandatory Skills Required Project Planning/Project Management, Wind Projects, Renewable Energy, Wind Energy, EPC Position Description Job Purpose The Deputy Head of EPC Wind plays a critical role in leading & coordinating the Project planning, Design & Engineering, Procurement, & Construction activities for wind energy projects within the renewable energy business  The primary objective is to ensure the successful execution of wind projects from conception to completion, meeting quality, safety, project costs & timeline objectives. Job Context & Major Challenges The fast pace changing Government Policies & Regulatory Framework, scarcity of land, changing technology, Supply Chain issue, environmental concerns & community engagement make the Wind EPC the most challenging area of work.  The incumbent is expected to update himself on ongoing basis to ensure efficient & effective management of the portfolio Principal Accountabilities  Project Planning & Project Management Collaborate with management to get approvals on project strategies, objectives, & execution plans. Oversee the entire project life cycle, from conceptualization to commissioning &  Handover / Takeover to O&M team. Develop & manage project schedules, budgets, & resources to ensure timely & cost-effective project delivery. Implement project management best practices to mitigate risks & ensure efficiency of the project execution & fulfill compliance with regulatory requirements Design, Construct & Resource Management Work seamlessly with the design of the engineering team in getting the most optimized wind energy systems  within budget. Ensure that engineering designs meet Technical Standards, environmental regulations, & project  specifications. Develop & implement supply chain strategies for sourcing materials & services required for project  execution within available budget. Develop & maintain cordial relationships with technology suppliers & services contractors. Define work schedules, service contracts & monitor the construction work adhering to quality standards & safety. Identify the training needs & ensure skill upgrade training completion before the start of the work Audit & Governance Create & maintain all the documentation of the work for statutory & internal audits. Provide technical advice & support to the senior management to take right decisions for the long-term success of the organization Play the pivotal role of champion of organizations standards across all the stakeholders (suppliers, contractors, external agencies) & protect reputation & brand name. Knowledge management Build & enhance the systems & processes for organization?? future success. Guide new talent & build competencies for the organization's success in the business. Provide technical expertise to land acquisition team to identify the right land parcel for getting maximum output. Keep update about development in the area of wind energy ??i.e. technology, regulation, weather patterns etc. Relationships (If Applicable) Internal :  Land Acquisition Team, Engineering & Design, Procurement & Supply Chain, Quality, Safety Regularly External :  Technology Partners, Contractors, Government Officials, politicians & community leaders Regularly Organizational Requirements: Should be from Mumbai / relocating to Mumbai with family in case of consideration. We should be looking for long term association so candidate should be less than 50 Technical / Professional Skills Negotiation Skills, Project Planning & Management General  Interview Process : 2R+HR R1 Interview will be FTF Interview Preferred Notice period:  30 days Sourcing Keywords :   Wind Energy, EPC, Renewable Energy, Project Planning, Project Management, Wind Projects Non-Technical / Soft Skills :  People Management, Time Management You are requested to E Mail updated Resume with following details  Current Location  Pl. Confirm you are ready to work in Mumbai  Gender: Male / Female  Total  experience in Renewable Power EPC Projects (In years)  Relevant experience Wind EPC Projects (In years) Please list our major Renewable Power EPC Projects & Wind EPC Projects managed  Do you have extensive experience in  project planning &  execution , design & Engineering ,  procurement & construction?  Do you have experience in meeting quality,  safety, project cost & timeline objectives for  renewable energy sector ?  Can you oversee the entire wind  project life cycle, from conceptualization to commissioning &  Handover / Takeover to the O & M team?  Can you collaborate with management to get approvals on project strategies, objectives, & execution plans? column2: Job Description: We are seeking an experienced and dynamic VP Construction to lead our construction team in planning, managing, and executing solar power projects.  Roles and Responsibility: 1.   Project Planning and Strategy:  Develop and implement construction strategies and plans for solar projects, appoint and oversee contractors, and collaborate with project managers and stakeholders to define project  objectives, timelines, and budgets. Utilize planning tools and software to optimize project scheduling and resource allocation. 2.   Construction Management:  Oversee the entire construction process from site preparation to commissioning, ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and meet quality and safety standards. Monitor construction progress and make necessary adjustments to achieve project goals. 3.   Team Leadership:  Build, mentor, train a high-performance construction team. 4.   Resource Management:  Manage and allocate construction resources, including labor, equipment, and materials, to optimize project efficiency. Coordinate with procurement, design, and logistics teams to ensure the timely availability of materials and equipment. 5.   Quality Assurance:  Implement and enforce quality control processes to ensure that construction work meets industry standards and project specifications. 6.   Safety Compliance:  Prioritize and promote a culture of safety on construction sites, monitor compliance with safety regulations, and take corrective actions to mitigate risks.     7.   Communication and Reporting:  Regularly communicate with senior management, project stakeholders, and clients to provide updates on project status, and prepare and present construction reports and progress updates to the leadership team.   Qualification and Requirements: B. Tech from reputed institute. Good Communication Skills in English. Ability to manage a Team. Desire to learn and grow. Conversant with key MS Office applications.
column11: Team Management, Site Monitoring, construction strategie, Construction Management, Construction Project Management, Planning, Resource Management

He should be conversant with the modern tools and techniques used for project quality management, monitoring and control. The leaders will install and guide competent teams, manage stakeholders & resources and ensure that there is constant communication between them and the stakeholders on the progress of the project and issues, if any are resolved at the earliest to avoid any delay or scope creep The Project Head will ensure the project monitoring, documentation and risk management is seamlessly managed.  Specifications of the Ideal Candidate :-   Seniority profile:-  The incumbent should have about 15 years of experience in execution and commissioning of similar scaled EPC  greenfield and brownfield projects for the steel, O&G, petrochemicals, power generation, and similar other process industries. At least past 5 years in a leadership role.   Domain :-  Metals & minerals in an integrated set-up, Industrial products, Capital Goods, process industries, having handled Capex in the range of 1500 Cr.   -  Qualification   :- BE/B.Tech in Metallurgy / Mechanical /Electrical and electronics -  Preferred :- M.Tech/ MBA and certified in project management   IT Skills-set :-  (PMP, PgMP, PfMP,Prince 2 etc.) Techno-commercial evaluation skills, sound understanding of design & engineering and proficiency in project management software, documentation management software, knowledge in ERP software and tools like Primavera P6 / MSP, contract negotiations and management, communication other power skills  Background :  - Should have led multi-faceted teams dealing with technology, engineering, procurement, construction, and the entire project execution Liaisoning :  - Dealing with government and regulatory agencies for approvals and allocations.

Ask for issue of all approved for construction drawings from client      and compute quantities of various items of work and requirement of raw      materials, bought out items. Planning the construction activities, ensuring quality of deliverables,      and meeting the time schedule. Administering contract with the sub-contractors. Responsible for      developing symbiotic relations with contractors and vendors in line with      compliance and company values, to have a positive influence on project      completion. Periodically meet with Operation & Maintenance stakeholders to      understand maintenance issues and to assess the associated risk profile in      relation to the overall system. Review key documentation associated with maintenance policy,      processes and programs in order to coordinate all required updates and      changes needed to meet asset performance requirements. Coordinate the development of procedures needed to standardize the      execution of civil and linear maintenance programs. Be receptive to situational requirements of other units and, where      required prioritize, reschedule particular work (s) to conform to overall      completion schedule. Keep in touch with client and PMC regularly, address their concern,      report & record all hindrances to work progress. Attend client meetings with progress report      and hindrance register. To lead and manage to control projects to produce key results consistently.  To establish direction and strategies to achieve the organization vision.  Completing project pre-planning processes, such as cost estimations and budgeting.  Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met.  To align the people to achieve the project goal. Negotiating contracts and obtaining permits  Managing on-site construction personnel Reviewing compliance with federal and local safety guidelines and standards Lead role in planning, executing, monitoring, controlling, and closing out projects.  Ensuring documentation work and verify the work done by the team.  Ensure proper work allocation, supervise and monitor the work carried away and team. Experience in Residential, Bungalows, Commercial Preferred In-depth understanding of      construction procedures and material and project management principles Bachelors degree in civil      engineering/ Diploma in civil engineering preferred. To organise work schedules, risk management, progress of certification and payment collections. Review of Tender Documents. Review all project management reports on a weekly basis in co-ordination with Project Manager and site team. Review of certification of payment, Bill Abstract and all other bill related formats for various Contractor bills Ensure site team timely does material reconciliations, monitor and control the material wastages at site. Manage daily operations, including employee training and development, contract negotiations and project planning. Maintain reports and records of the budgets and expenses of the projects. Reviewing / developing operational process flows. Responsible for managing all costs related to construction projects. Primarily estimate and monitor project costs, from the early design to the final construction stages. Review of scope of work, project Preamble, Drawings and Specifications. To work closely with project managers, site engineers and sub-contractors to ensure a project is cost-effective and meets quality standards. Evaluation of Material Specification and Prices of Vendors /Subcontractors against Project Specifications. Monitoring projects with respect to budgeted cost, demand forecasts, time over-runs to ensure timely execution of projects. Coordinate technical and Commercial meetings with site team and subcontractors. Ensuring Quality and Safety Standard. Assures all completed projects meet quality requirements in accordance with job specifications and scope. Preparing MIS reports. Regular visit to all sites. Preparing deviation and variation statement for final payments of the Contractors. Process implementation with periodic reviews and recommendations for process improvement for business effectiveness. column2: Job Description:  Civil Project Head/CGM (High-rise Construction Specialist ) Position Overview: We are seeking a highly experienced Civil Project Head with a minimum of 20 years of experience in the civil industry, preferably with a specialization in high-rise constructions. Experience in Myvan shuttering techniques is considered an added advantage. The ideal candidate will possess a BTech qualification in Civil Engineering (M Tech is an Added Advantage) and demonstrate extensive knowledge in civil engineering, mechanical ventilation, vertical transportation, electrical, plumbing, and other essential construction project aspects. This role requires exemplary coordination skills to liaise effectively with consultants attend meetings, and ensure seamless project execution. Key Responsibilities: Project Leadership : Provide strategic leadership and direction to high-rise construction projects, ensuring adherence to project timelines, budgets, and quality standards. Technical Expertise : Utilize comprehensive knowledge and experience in high-rise construction methodologies, including Myvan shuttering, to drive efficient project planning, design, and execution. Multi-disciplinary Coordination : Coordinate with consultants, architects, structural engineers, MEP (mechanical, electrical, plumbing) contractors, and other stakeholders to integrate various technical aspects seamlessly into project planning and execution. Meeting Attendance and Coordination : Act as the primary point of contact for project coordination, attending meetings, design reviews, and progress updates to provide technical insights, resolve issues, and ensure alignment with project objectives. Risk Management : Identify potential risks and challenges inherent in high-rise construction projects and develop proactive strategies to mitigate them effectively. Quality Assurance : Implement robust quality control measures to ensure that construction activities comply with relevant codes, regulations, and industry standards, maintaining the highest level of quality throughout the project lifecycle. Budget and Schedule Management : Monitor project budgets, expenses, and schedules meticulously, identifying opportunities for cost optimization and schedule acceleration while maintaining quality and safety standards. Team Leadership and Development : Provide mentorship, guidance, and support to project team members, fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment conducive to achieving project goals and exceeding client expectations. Requirements: *Minimum of 20 years of hands-on experience in the civil industry, with a focus on high-rise construction projects. Experience in Myvan shuttering techniques is an added advantage. *BTech qualification in Civil Engineering (M Tech is an Added Advantage) from a recognized institution. *Extensive knowledge and expertise in civil engineering principles, high-rise construction methodologies, mechanical ventilation systems, vertical transportation, electrical, plumbing, and other essential construction project aspects. *Proven track record of successfully managing and delivering high-rise construction projects on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. *Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders, teams, and contractors. *Exceptional leadership abilities, with a demonstrated capacity to inspire, motivate, and lead project teams towards achieving excellence in project delivery. *Proficiency in project management tools and software applications for efficient project planning scheduling, and monitoring. *Additional certifications or training in project management, construction management, or related fields. *Familiarity with sustainable construction practices and green building principles applicable to high-rise constructions. *Experience working on complex, multi-disciplinary projects in the real estate, commercial, residential, or institutional sectors. *In-depth knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and permitting processes relevant to high-rise construction projects.
column11: Project Leadership, Risk Management, Team Development, Budget Management, Team Leadership, Project Development, Quality Assurance, Project Planning

column2: Roles and Responsibilities     Job Title: EHV (Extra High Voltage) Project Manager Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced EHV Project Manager to oversee and manage the planning, design, and construction of Extra High Voltage (EHV) transmission and distribution projects. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that projects are completed on time, within budget, and in compliance with safety and quality standards. Key Responsibilities: Manage the planning, design, and construction of EHV transmission and distribution projects, including coordinating with internal and external stakeholders. Develop project schedules, budgets, and resource plans to ensure project success. Manage project risks, including identifying and mitigating potential risks. Ensure that projects are completed within the scope, schedule, and budget. Develop and maintain relationships with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure project success. Ensure compliance with safety and quality standards and regulations. Prepare project status reports and other documentation for management and stakeholders. Provide leadership and guidance to project team members. Continuously improve project management processes and methodologies to increase efficiency and effectiveness. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, or related field. Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in EHV project management, preferably in the transmission and distribution industry. Knowledge of EHV systems, equipment, and technologies. Strong project management skills, including project planning, scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Proficient in project management software and tools. Desired Candidate Profile   Perks and Benefits   pF, ESIC, HEALTH INSURANCE
